name: 1080p Balanced+
description:
1080p Balanced targets consistent & immutable 1080p **WEB-DLs** with fallback to transparent x264 encodes, prioritised using the **Golden Popcorn Performance Index**.

- Special considerations are given to **Balanced** groups who prioritize **streaming optimisation** over quality, falling somewhere around a tier 2 WEB-DL. This includes groups like **BHDStudio** and **hallowed**.
- If no 1080p release can be found, the profile will fall back to SD releases - DVD remuxes  / encodes. 

- Balanced+ adds another layer on top that includes H265 WEB-DLs from isolated groups as well as HONE Blurays.

qualities.name: Balanced Capable
qualities.description: Balanced Capable releases. Typically WEB-DL would be the overwhelming majority of releases, but there are occasional streaming optimised encodes that should be preferred.

qualities.name: 720p Fallback
qualities.description: Fallback to 720p when 1080p cannot be found.

qualities.name: SD Fallback
qualities.description: Standard Definition Fallbacks

name: 1080p Quality (HDR)
description:
1080p Quality (HDR) utilizes the [**Golden Popcorn Performance Index**](https://dictionarry.dev/wiki/GPPi) to target **transparent x265 HDR** 1080p encodes. 
- 5 Quality tiers prioritise encodes with high 1080p GPPi scores, with fallback to the regular 1080p Quality profile (non HDR), then 1080p WEB-DLs and streaming optimised encodes (**BHDStudio & hallowed**).
- **x265 is negated** but allowed, if and only if a reputable GPPi group has encoded it from a UHD Bluray source.
- Non HDR x265 encodes are strictly forbidden in this profile
- If no 1080p release can be found, the profile will fall back to SD releases - **DVD remuxes  / encodes**

qualities.name: Transparent Capable
qualities.description: All capable of being indistinguishable from source. WEB-DL included to not allow unknown encode to trump known WEB-DL.

qualities.description: Fallback to 720p when 1080p cannot be found.

qualities.name: SD Fallback
qualities.description: Standard Definition Fallbacks

name: 1080p Quality
description:
1080p Quality utilizes the [**Golden Popcorn Performance Index**](https://dictionarry.dev/wiki/GPPi) to target **transparent** x264 1080p encodes. 
- 5 Quality tiers prioritise encodes with high 1080p GPPi scores, with fallback to 1080p WEB-DLs and streaming optimised encodes (**BHDStudio & hallowed**).
- If no 1080p release can be found, the profile will fall back to SD releases - **DVD remuxes  / encodes**

name: 1080p Remux
description:
1080p Remux utilizes **audio tags** to prioritise high quality lossless copies of HD Blu-rays.

- Unlike the encode profiles, which target releases based on a release group metric, 1080p Remux avoids this to stop *circular downloads* where no discernable upgrade is found. 
- Instead, audio metrics such TrueHD, Atmos, DTS-X, etc are used to indicate when a remux should be upgraded.
- This also helps to grab non group tagged remuxes, which are fairly common on quite a few trackers who often have the best remux available. 
- If no 1080p Remux cannot be found, the profile falls back to **1080p WEB-DLs**.
- If no 1080p release can be found, the profile will fall back to SD releases - DVD remuxes  / encodes.

qualities.name: SD Fallback
qualities.description: Standard Definition Fallbacks

upgrade_until.name: Remux-1080p
upgrade_until.description: 1080p Blu-ray disc content remuxed into a playable file format

name: 2160p Balanced
description:
2160p Balanced targets consistent & immutable 2160p **HDR WEB-DLs w/ Lossy Audio**. 
- Special considerations are given to **Balanced** groups who prioritize **streaming optimisation** over quality, falling somewhere around a tier 2 WEB-DL. This includes groups like **BHDStudio**, **HONE** and **hallowed**.
- If no 2160p WEB-DL can be found, the profile will fall back to the 1080p Quality Profile.
- Transparent 2160p Encodes (à la  2160p Quality) are not allowed as fallback since they are comparatively much larger than 2160p WEB-DLs

name: 2160p Quality
description:
2160p Quality utilizes the [**Encode Efficiency Index**](https://dictionarry.dev/wiki/EEi) metric at a 55% target ratio to prioritize **transparent** x265 4k encodes. 

- 4 quality tiers prioritize encodes from reputable groups, with fallback to high-quality WEB-DLs and balanced tier groups. 2 additional quality tiers are placed below for further fallback. 
- Special considerations for both **HDR** and **Lossless Audio** formats help to push lower tiered encodes over higher tier ones in cases where better sources are used.
- If no 2160p release can be found, the profile will fall back to the 1080p Quality Profile.

qualities.name: 2160p Transparent
qualities.description: Indistinguishable from source

qualities.description: Standard Definition Fallbacks

name: 2160p Remux
description:
2160p Remux utilizes **audio / video tags** to prioritise high quality lossless copies of UHD Blu-rays.

- Unlike the encode profiles, which target releases based on a release group metric, 2160p Remux avoids this to stop *circular downloads* where no discernable upgrade is found. 
- Instead, audio / video metrics such Dolby Vision, TrueHD, Atmos, HDR10+, etc are used to indicate when a remux should be upgraded.
- For instance, if a hybrid remux that includes some WEB DoVi layer is released, it will be upgraded over the standard non hybrid release, regardless of release group.
- This also helps to grab non group tagged remuxes, which are fairly common on quite a few trackers who often have the best remux available. 
- If no 2160p Remux cannot be found, the profile falls back to **2160p WEB-DLs**.
- If a 2160p WEB-DL cannot be found, the profile falls back to the **1080p Remux** profile.

qualities.name: SD Fallback
qualities.description: Standard Definition Fallbacks

upgrade_until.name: Remux-2160p
upgrade_until.description: 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray disc content remuxed into a playable file format

- If no 720p release can be found, the profile will fall back to SD releases - **DVD remuxes  / encodes**
